bug.short_desc: Cinnamon unresponsive, time gap grows over time.
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Hi, help please.
I got this problem all the time since F24, (now on F25) on various laptops.
-------------
Description: *Something* happens.
Then some parts of the cinnamon starts to be unresponsive. Mainly the "screen brightness up/down" buttons. Then the lock screen. Then even "su" command! What's more, the time, when it is unresponsive grows over time! First, it can be second, or two ... or ten. Then minutes.
The real problem is, that you, for example, set "brightness up". But nothing happens. For a minute. You want to walk of your laptop, so you want to lock it, but you can't because it is unresponsive. So you sit down and use a keaboard shortcut to open file manager and terminal. But they are frozen too. So you click on the terminal icon, and want to restart your computer. You enter "su". But well ... it freeze for a while too.
It is really annoying andit can occur few times a day in a scale I have to force restart the laptop.
-------------
I haven't ever found any hint, what could cause it, however, I experience it more often, when I put the machine to sleep mode and wake it up a few times. (wich is my basic usecase through a day)
Don't hesistate to "needinfo" me on everything you would need.
cinnamon-screensaver-3.2.14-0.2.20170124git5561f3c.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-855ed02f31
cinnamon-screensaver-3.2.14-0.2.20170124git5561f3c.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-cfb76d98fc

Thanks for investigation.
I installed the package from Bodhi updates, however, my feedback can be delayed, since I have no idea, what cause this bug.

cinnamon-screensaver-3.2.14-0.2.20170124git5561f3c.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-cfb76d98fc

cinnamon-screensaver-3.2.14-0.2.20170124git5561f3c.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-855ed02f31

As i mentioned in the Bodhi, this update ^ did not solved the issue.
However, I have more information:
When it happens, it breaks mounting. Whatever you pick - USB flash drive, external HDD or SD card, it can't be mounter with error message "Not authorized to perform this operation".
I checked "dmesg", seems alright. I checked "journalctl -xe", but I don't know, what to look for.
for example (?): "Ãºno 22 00:24:02 my-ntb python3[15165]: detected unhandled Python exception in '/usr/share/cinnamon-screensaver/cinnamon-screensaver-command.py' "
Give me some suggestions where to look and for what, and I'll try to catch the cause or make some reproducer.
cinnamon-screensaver-3.2.14-0.2.20170124git5561f3c.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
cinnamon-screensaver-3.2.14-0.2.20170124git5561f3c.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

Unfortunatelly, I'm still strucked with this issue :/ But hey, I have some new info!
Recently, I ran 'dnf upgrade', which, after some research showed, I must have somehow damaged systemd. Systemd scripts are looping infinitely, deamons fails to restart and so on ...
I believe, this could be the cause of delays and freezes.
Now the bad news: I fight with this bug daily since F24, for more than half a year. I re-installed Fedora dozens times, without MAJOR configuration (of course, I install my beloved programs and stuff for work and configure the environment, but I never touched 'deep' settings of the system)
I'll leave this bug report closed for now, and I'll start to solve this with systemd guys.
